result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto J Jimenez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Roberto J Jimenez
parties.address: 19120 W Observatory Rd, New Berlin, WI 53146

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 3 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied.  Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with any Target Store or Floyd M. (except for purposes of work).

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
Defendant to report to Huber Facility by 06:00 p.m. on 03-21-2016.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Roberto J Jimenez in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.



Court orders the following:
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
3 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 12 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  any Target Store or Floyd M. (accept for purposes of work).
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $243
Apply Bail.
